Award.AwardTitle: Support for 2016 Workshop on EFRI-ODISSEI Research
Award.AbstractNarration: NSF has made an award in support of students and faculty to participate in a conference on the topic of Origami Design for Integration of Self-assembling Systems for Engineering Innovation (ODISSEI). The conference will be held at Florida International University (FIU), Feb 11-12, 2016. The objective of the conference is to bring together ODISSEI researchers and students who have already been funded by the Emerging Frontiers in Research and Innovation (EFRI) program, in order to create fertile interactions between the different research groups that are working to couple origami with engineering and/or science. The researchers will provide updates on their progress and students will present and discuss their research during a poster session. The multidisciplinary/multi-experience makeup of attendees relative to backgrounds (e.g., artists, mechanical engineers, bioengineers, materials engineers, and electrical engineers) and research experience (e.g., well-known/well-established investigators, junior faculty members, students and underrepresented minorities) is expected to positively impact the field. Planned networking sessions will enable organic interactions between young researchers and senior investigators, and government attendees who will interact and exchange information.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The goals of this workshop were to:

1. Pioneer the application of origami to solve multi-disciplinary engineering and science problems and develop new technologies and

2. Share the research results of the EFRI-ODISSEI research groups and bring all the groups together in a multi-disciplinary workshop to pioneer the emerging research of origami in engineering and science.

This workshop brought together the research groups that have been funded by the EFRI-ODISSEI program in order to create fertile interactions between the different research groups that are working to couple origami with engineering and/or science. Also, the workshop brought together researchers (faculty and students), NSF PMs and AFOSR PMs.

Dr. Georgakopoulos organized and chaired the 2016 Workshop on Origami Design for Integration of Self-Assembling Systems for Engineering Innovation (ODISSEI) on February 11-12, 2016, which was hosted at Florida International University, Miami, FL. Listed below, are some important facts related to this workshop:
1. 12 research groups funded from the EFRI-ODISSEI program participated and presented their work
2. 12 technical presentations were given by researchers
3. 1 keynote speaker presentation was given by Mario Rotea, Division Director, NSF Division of Engineering Education and Centers
4. 1 keynote speaker presentation by AFOSR PM
5. Government agencies participated,
6. The workshop presentations were shared with EFRI, NSF.
7. This workshop also facilitated collaborations with other government agencies, such as, AFOSR.
